title: CSS Selectors
ques: What is the difference between class and ID selectors in CSS? Provide an example.

answer.content:
This is a class selector example.

This is an ID selector example.

explanation:
***Class Selector*** is used to style multiple elements, while ***ID Selector*** is used to style a single unique element.

- The ***```.class-selector```*** applies styles to all elements with that class.
- The ***```#id-selector```*** applies styles to a specific element with that ID.
- ***Class selectors*** are defined using ```.``` (dot) before the class name.
- ***ID selectors*** are defined using ```#``` (hash) before the ID name.

In the given code:
- The paragraph with ```class="class-selector"``` turns ***blue***.
- The paragraph with ```id="id-selector"``` turns ***red***.

title: CSS Properties
ques: What are CSS properties, and how are they used? Provide an example.

answer.content: This paragraph has CSS properties applied.

explanation:
***CSS properties*** define how elements should appear on a webpage.

- ***```color```***: Sets the text color.
- ***```font-size```***: Sets the font size.

In the given example:
- The paragraph text color is set to ***green*** using ```color: green;```.
- The font size is set to ***20px*** using ```font-size: 20px;```.

title: CSS Values
ques: What are CSS values, and how do they work with properties? Provide an example.
explanation:
***CSS values*** define how properties behave.

- Properties take values to apply styles.
- Different properties accept different types of values.

In the given example:
- ```color: red;``` applies a ***red*** color to the ```h1```.
- ```font-size: 24px;``` sets the font size to ***24 pixels***.
- ```text-align: center;``` centers the heading text.

title: CSS Syntax
ques: What is the syntax of a CSS rule? Provide an example.
explanation:
***CSS syntax*** consists of three parts:

1. ***Selector***: Specifies the HTML element to style.
2. ***Property***: Defines the aspect to modify (e.g., color, font-size).
3. ***Value***: Specifies the setting for the property.

Example:
- ```h1 { color: blue; }```
- Here, ***```h1```*** is the ***selector***.
- ***```color```*** is the ***property***.
- ***```blue```*** is the ***value*** applied.

title: Universal and Group Selectors
ques: How do universal and group selectors work in CSS? Provide an example.
explanation:
***Universal Selector (```*```)*** applies styles to all elements in the document.
- In ```* { margin: 0; padding: 0; }```, it removes default margin and padding from all elements.

***Group Selector (```,```)*** allows applying styles to multiple elements at once.
- ```h1, h2, p { font-family: Arial, sans-serif; }``` sets the font for ```h1```, ```h2```, and ```p``` together.

title: Attribute Selectors
ques: What is an attribute selector in CSS? Provide an example.

answer.content:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <style>
        input[type="text"] {
            border: 2px solid blue;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <input type="text" placeholder="Text input">
    <input type="password" placeholder="Password input">
</body>
</html>

explanation:
***Attribute Selectors*** target elements based on attributes.
- ```input[type="text"]``` selects only ```<input>``` elements where ```type``` is ***"text"***.
- This applies a ***blue border*** to text inputs but not to password inputs.

title: Pseudo-classes
ques: What are pseudo-classes in CSS? Provide an example.
explanation:
***Pseudo-classes*** define a special state of an element.

- ```a:hover { color: red; }``` changes a link's color to ***red*** when hovered.
- ```input:focus { background-color: yellow; }``` highlights an input field ***yellow*** when focused.

title: Pseudo-elements
ques: What are pseudo-elements in CSS? Provide an example.
explanation:
***Pseudo-elements*** style specific parts of elements.

- ```p::first-letter``` styles the ***first letter*** of a paragraph.
- ```p::before``` adds content ***before*** each paragraph.

title: CSS Box Model
ques: What is the CSS Box Model? Provide an example.
explanation:
***Box Model*** consists of ***width, padding, border, and margin***.

- ```width: 200px;``` sets the content width.
- ```padding: 20px;``` adds space inside the border.
- ```border: 5px solid black;``` adds a ***black border***.
- ```margin: 10px;``` adds space outside the element.

title: CSS Units
ques: What are different CSS units? Provide an example.
explanation:
***CSS Units*** define measurements.

- ```em```: Relative to the parent font size (```2em``` means ***twice the parent size***).
- ```%```: Relative to the parent element's size (```width: 50%``` makes the paragraph half the parent's width).

title: CSS Inheritance
ques: How does inheritance work in CSS? Provide an example.
explanation:
***Inheritance*** allows child elements to inherit properties from their parent.

- ```color: blue;``` in ```body``` applies ***blue*** text to all elements inside.
- ```font-size: 16px;``` in ```p``` sets ***paragraphs*** to 16px but does not affect other elements.
